intro: Barbarea intermedia, commonly known as common winter cress, is an annual flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other mustard plants. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, featuring basal leaves that are lobed or divided and small, yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. The plant is known for its peppery taste and has been used in some traditional cuisines.
